programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: No. 12 seed Texas Tech (52-13) and No. 2 seed Oklahoma (53-8) meet in a winner-take-all matchup with the victorious team advancing to the best-of-three championship to face the winner between No. 6 seed Texas and No. 7 seed Tennessee for the title.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Rivalries come to be for various reasons, but a hit by Claude Lemieux of the Colorado Avalanche on Kris Draper of the Detroit Red Wings in the late 1990s would ignite a rivalry in the NHL that would stand the test of time between the two teams.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two of the more prestigious names in the UFC coach their teams of up-and-coming fighters, who are in search of a UFC contract for winning the season, as they compete against each other in the Octagon and in challenges outside of the bouts.

programme.title: Major League Rugby
programme.desc: Houston (9-0-5) comes off a 14-9 loss to Seattle on May 23; Chicago (10-0-5) snapped a three-match losing skid to the SaberCats and earned its first-ever win in the series with a 25-22 victory on the road to open the season on Feb. 15.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season as a key defender and rebounder.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title throughout the 1990s.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan's fame peaked to unparalleled levels in the early 1990s in the wake of consecutive NBA titles and a starring role on the Olympic Dream Team, his image as "Air Jordan" made him a profoundly significant cultural figure.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: The world's top-ranked cornhole players finish out the the ACL Signature #2 and Open #13 at the Arizona Athletic Grounds in Mesa, Arizona for a combined $50,000 in prize money; ACL Pro Teams contest a set of regular season matches.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: South Carolina baseball coach Ray Tanner made it a point for the players to visit a children's hospital each season, as the players during the 2010 and 2011 national title seasons formed a bond with two special kids undergoing cancer treatment.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis (7-2) won five-straight games after a 39-13 win over San Antonio behind Max Duggan and Brandon Silvers; DC (6-3) defeated the Battlehawks, 27-15, on April 13 behind 243 passing yards and three touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Postgame
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent game with highlights and interviews with players and managers, along with looking around the rest of the MLB to update games in progress and show highlights of the completed games to cover the day's action.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Milwaukee won two of its three games at American Family Field earlier this season, winning the rubber game of the series, 8-2; Milwaukee won five of its seven games at Great American Ball Park last season, outscoring the Reds, 51-29.
